title: Warlock's mirror
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A handheld array of hexagonal mirrors, synthesized from a truly exotic substance and polished to a blinding sheen. A skilled user will find that it can reflect almost anything, even spells that pierce through lesser materials and hexes with no physical manifestation at all. |

[![Warlock.png](/images/5/51/Warlock.png)](/File:Warlock.png) ***the +3 warlock's mirror***

+3 [buckler](/Buckler "Buckler")

[Reflection](/Reflection "Reflection") ego  
Can also reflect [piercing](/Piercing "Piercing") attacks, enchantments, and never-missing attacks

## Mechanics

For piercing attacks, such as [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") and [bolt spells](/Bolt_spell "Bolt spell"), the chance to block is determined by [SH](/SH "SH"), like any attack you can block normally.

For enchantments and never-missing attacks, the chance to block is equal to `2*SH / (2*SH + 20)`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) All sources of SH count. Unlike normal blocking, this reflection does not 'decay' after multiple blocks. This equates to 37.5% at 6 [SH](/SH "SH"), reaches 50% at 10 SH, 66% at 20 SH, and gradually increases further from there.

It cannot block [smite-targeted](/Smite-targeted "Smite-targeted") attacks, explosions like [Fireball](/Fireball "Fireball"), or other sorts of AOE effects.

## Desirability

The **warlock's mirror**[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) is a fairly useful shield, especially in places with many piercing attacks (such as [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") in [the Shoals](/The_Shoals "The Shoals")) or enchantments. Even if the enemy is immune to their own attacks, the omnireflect is useful - it lets you block otherwise unblockable effects.

However, this shield is still a buckler. Heavier characters or those with lots of Shields skill might prefer a [tower shield](/Tower_shield "Tower shield") or a highly enchanted [kite shield](/Kite_shield "Kite shield"), which are more effective against attacks you can block normally. But for those who would use a buckler anyway, there are few better options.

The mirror can block [Malmutate](/Malmutate "Malmutate"), so it can be a strong(er) choice in places where malmutation is common.

## History

- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), the warlock's mirror only had a `2*SH / (2*SH + 40)` chance to reflect never-missing effects, and couldn't reflect piercing physical projectiles like [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin").
- The warlock's mirror was introduced in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [beam.cc:6853](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/beam.cc#L6853) (0.30.1)  
   Note that 'internal' SH is twice as high as your actual SH score.
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [art-data.txt:1520](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/art-data.txt#L1520) (0.30.0)
